website_summaries.verdict: The Flip-Pal mobile scanner offers an innovative design with PC-free scanning, a 4 by 6 flatbed, and a neat trick for scanning originals that won't fit under the flatbed lid.
pros: Can scan originals larger than its 4 by 6 flatbed
cons: Can't zoom in on scanned image to check quality

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly good.  Far exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make a digital copy of a Creative Memories style 12"x12" scrapbook. It took a couple practice runs to get the hang of it, but once I go t the hang of it, everything went smoothly, somewhat tediously, but smoothly. At 4 scans per page, it took a while, but it was well worth the trouble for the quality of the final output. The stitching logic it uses to create a single image per page is really phenomenal. I didn't see any artifacts. Every page looked like it had been scanned in a single pass. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Inactive Fred

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, with good quality reproduction. Two design issues, though. One, either the power button or the scan button should be moved away from each other. It is too easy to accidentally push the off button when you mean to push the scan button. Two, I know this is meant to be portable, which is great, but it would be nice to have the option to plug it into an outlet to save on batteries. I have a ton of photos that are out of albums so I want to just sit at the table and scan but it uses batteries fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for memory keeping
customer_reviews.text: I loved the concept of this device, but the scanned pictures turn out HORRIBLE. Streaks in every position using top and bottom glass and turning pic sideways on the top glass. see for yourself. Not good. Don't know what I would use this for now. Pictures.. NOPE.
customer_reviews.author: WeTa

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten a lot of good use from this, though I haven't attempted stitching together for large photos. Because the scanner is fragile and is meant to carry to relatives' homes for scanning photos right out of their albums (without needing to tear them loose for conventional feed scanning ) it's important to have the device well protected for packing and traveling, and the deluxe case works perfectly for that (it cost another $15). I expect is is fragile, but I've handled it carefully and have gotten a lot of good use from it. It's easier to manipulate without a cord, so I don't mind replacing the batteries after every 200 scans or so. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Black Hole Gang

customer_reviews.title: Digitizing my old nrgatoves.
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur genealogist who wants to place pictures with the names. Upon discovering old family negatives I went looking for a scanner that could carefully digitize these items. The Flip Pal enables me to place the negative on a light table for scanning. Imaging software allows me to turn the negative image into a positive. It works so well that I now am contemplating scanning all our negatives to convert to digital images.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This can stitch together images from larger pieces to make a single image, but it is a pain. Don't bother if you plan to scan things larger than a regular sized check.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H. Titus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service. Works as promised.
customer_reviews.text: First, the amazing part. I immediately lost the SD card containing its scanning software. I emailed them, and a replacement appeared in just a day or two. I am so grateful for that. Second, it works as advertised but will be a little cumbersome for large images. The active scanner portion is about the size of a postcard, which is of course expected because the unit is meant to travel with you. That means you may have to run it 3 times each way for an A4 size image. Finally, the software that stitches the images together isn't, say, Apple-simple but it absolutely does the job. I strongly recommend this product and feel it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to scan photos while traveling to relatives. Some have no wifi. I've been using it at home and it's perfect, and so easy to use. The stitching is flawless. The batteries that came with it were used up quickly but I bought rechargables so I should never have a problem there. Got a case for it too. Can't wait to travel with it and scan old family photos to share with other family members. Perfect for documents too.

customer_reviews.title: OK for old family photos
customer_reviews.text: Does what I bought it to do - quickly scan hundreds of photos out of old family albums. It gets 4 stars for convenience and 2 stars for using only batteries. Even on 300 dpi, you will get about 150 photos for four batteries, tops. Scan quality is about what you would expect for second generation. The clear paper in the photo album posed a problem if it was wrinkled; otherwise, it did not appear to affect the quality of the scan. If you need something for professional presentations, there are better options; however, I would probably buy it again for my stated purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Matt's Mom

customer_reviews.title: So happy!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! Got this yesterday and been a scanning fool since it was delivered. All my grandma's old pictures uploaded to our family tree. I'm one happy girl! Down side it EATS batteries. Defiantly add a set or 2 of rechargeable batteries to your cart. It takes 4 AA batteries!
customer_reviews.author: mommyof5

customer_reviews.title: Great for convenient scanning of photos
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is so easy to use and works great while traveling or if scanning a large quantity of photos. It can be set up anywhere. I will scan a group of photos and then take the card and load into my computer to cleanup and store. I do genealogy and this is wonderful for working with family photos. I wish they made one to scan larger documents in one piece. You can scan them, but you have to do in sections and then piece together on computer.
customer_reviews.author: Baxanna McClure

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.  Absolutely no regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Three years later. and I still love this scanner. OMG. I LOOOOOVE THIS THING. I took it to the hospital as I sat with my very ill family member along with shoe boxes full of pictures. I got most of my precious memories digitally scanned. I have not used the stitch feature. I simply go to my computer for the larger pictures. We will start working on this years reunion book soon. I will take it along to capture photos that family members have without having the responsibility of taking those irreplaceable pictures with me. It would be great if I could have an electrical plug. I ran through a ton of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every family should have one!
customer_reviews.text: Love to look at old photos, but your relatives glued them into photo albums? This is your solution! Buy a Flip-Pal and you can scan photos with a lot less hassle. The photos save onto a card, so you can easily load them into your computer. You look through the window and can see exactly how the photo is lining up. Every genealogist should get one of these. If you glued your favorite photos into scrapbooks and now wish you had made a copy, here is how you can get that task done easily!
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Didn’t think it was really necessary since we have multiple scanners already. Boy was I wrong!!! Love this scanner. I went around scanning everything I could think of because it was so easy and fun. Must have for any scrapbooking or embroidery pattern making.
customer_reviews.author: M R

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed it would not scan larger photos and documents
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed it would not scan larger photos and documents, other wise, it seems to function as advertised. I purchased rechargeable batteries because batteries do not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for doing small photos right out of the photo albums!
customer_reviews.text: I will be using the scanner to take photos for a lady's 100th birthday party. We want to show photos of her life but don't want to have to take the photos out of albums to scan them. This will be perfect for that! I love that it can do 4x6 photos easily. I just wish it could do 8x10. I haven't been able to figure out the stitch method yet. I took the scans but couldn't get the software to stitch them into one photo. I will keep trying until I figure it out though. It would just be so convenient if the scanner would scan up to an 8x10 size!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner. Good value
customer_reviews.text: I really like this scanner. I have a number of old photos that I wanted to scan in order to save. This scanner is light and very mobile. It works well and is very easy to use. The 4GB SD card holds a great number of photos. The card was easy to remove from the scanner and insert into my laptop with the USB adapter included to save the photos there. I'm so pleased with the product. I would, however, recommend that anyone purchasing it would do well to purchase the carrying case to protect the scanner from damage and dust.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: I love my flip pal
customer_reviews.text: I love my flip pal. I can take it to courthouses and copy big documents then just click on the pieces and the software puts them together as if it was copied as one page. Over-sized things like scrapbooks can now be digitized and look great. Regular sized pictures fit right on it to copy. I took it to my grandson's class where I volunteer once a week and copied some of his work! His father (my son) has passed so it was a way for other members of our side of the family to see what he has done. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lorita

customer_reviews.title: Great Photo Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I have inherited most of my family's photos, and I am working to store them all digitally. This scanner works so well! It's very fast. Photos scan right the first time. I've had no problem using the stitching tool for large photos or photos that I don't want to remove from albums. I scanned about 1,000 photos in under 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JennyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Scans have a line through them
customer_reviews.text: This is portable and easy to use, but right out of the box, the scanner produced images with a black line through them. Nothing I can do to fix this, so it is useless. I looked online, and supposedly this happens if dust gets into the scanner through the hinges of the lid. Unhappy I wasted money on something that was defective right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: Missing a lot of stuff
customer_reviews.text: I haven't received a reply as yet. The product works great BUT Flip Pal box was missing: 1. Stitching and color restoration software 2. Quick start guide 3. 1-year Limited Warranty: 4. Batteries supplied were dead.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrene Baum-Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love this scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is fast and true color. Love the portability of it. I am scanning our deceased mother's pictures so all siblings can access them.
customer_reviews.author: Edna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and save old photos.
customer_reviews.text: This device is AMAZING! I have hundreds of photos from my deceased mother. With five kids, many of us wanted the same photos. Flip-Pal is easy to use and I upload to my computer to share with my brothers. Haven't done a lot of the stitching for larger photos but excited to go to work on them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scherting

customer_reviews.title: Small, Portable and FAST !
customer_reviews.text: This is just the right size to scan 4 x 6 photos but larger images can be scanned using the included stitching software. This scanner will scan 3 individual photos at 300 dpi faster than my large flatbed scanner will scan 3 photos at one time, and I am not tied to the desk to do it. Battery power means it works anywhere, in front of the TV, at the library or on a picnic table at a family reunion! I do think the Flip-Pal case is overpriced and I found a well padded pistol case that works just fine for under $10.00.
customer_reviews.author: V. O. Ritter

customer_reviews.title: I love It
customer_reviews.text: Love my flip pal. You can use a regular scanner for your picture scanning but the mobility of this is why I got it. It does not take much space, you can use a small case for it and take it with you when you need a scanner. I love the software that comes with it that allows you to scan large photos in several scans and reassembles them for you into one photo.
customer_reviews.author: Justtexas

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this item for over a year now and am pleased that it has held up to scanning hundreds of family photos. Quality of pictures is great. Also it is so easy to use and the ‘stitch’ feature could not be better!
customer_reviews.author: Karen F.

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. The only negative to me is using it for a larger picture. It certainly works....don't get me wrong....it is just more difficult to use for larger pictures. Positively would recommend this product. I scanned so many pictures in just minutes. What I also like about it is that it is super easy for "older" people to use and to be able to share pictures with relatives or genealogy folks. I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E. Olmstead

customer_reviews.title: I really like it with an exception of it being battery operated
customer_reviews.text: I really like it with an exception of it being battery operated. It eats through batteries and doesn't have a plug in option. I love that the top comes off and can scan directly on the ablum. Over all, I really like this product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wish I got one a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: A great little scanner. Good quality scans, quick, really handy - don't need the computer around when you want to scan something. Batteries seem to last a long time. Files stored on any SD card, in the same format your camera does, works slick. And it's the only thing I know that can scan scrapbooks and photo albums as-is, without pulling pics out. Only a 4x6 scan area but the stitching software that comes with it really works great, so getting larger images when needed is no problem. Note that the FlipPal's technology came out of HP Fort Collins so there's solid hardware and software design behind this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Freeman

customer_reviews.title: I love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner. Found it even works on the microfilm machines if you put it right up to the lighted screen which is fantastic because the local genealogy group does not have a printer connected to their microfilm reader and the one at the library does not work well. Also used it to copy all my credit cards as well as membership cards and drivers license just case they get lost or stolen. Works fantastic and is small and not cumbersome in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Martys

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up for this compact scanner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner after having read several reviews by other amateur genealogists. It traveled to our family reunion and was perfect for scanning snapshots brought by the family for sharing. The 'stitch' feature in the software works amazingly well for photos that were too large to scan on the bed of the scanner. The compact size of the unit made it very convenient to slip into a carry-on bag (inside its Deluxe Carry Case). The batteries lasted longer than I expected, but if I were going to do a lot of scanning, I might invest in some high-quality rechargeables.
customer_reviews.author: treehugger

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a way cool little machine. I have hundreds of old postcards that I plan to scan for my personal use and then donate to a historical group at the university. I've been putting off scanning for years because it would be such a pain with my regular scanner. This is easy. (Though I will say that I am not looking forward to having to crop and rotate each postcard individually.)
customer_reviews.author: Glenda M

customer_reviews.title: What a great little portable scanner for those old 4 x 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great little portable scanner for those old 4 x 6 or smaller photos. While watching a football game on the tube, I scanned about 350 photos. Love that they go on an SD card. Easily removable to a card reader for the computer. Only down side is that it loves to eat batteries. I bought a set of rechargeable batteries to combat the problem. Would be nice to have an AC adapter but all in all would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mhc

customer_reviews.title: This is the best product that I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product that I have ever purchased!!!! Every household should have one!! I have bought them for my daughters & families, my grandchildren etc. I love the fact that you can copy anything, any size & it will put it together using the program. It is wonderful for your "old" pictures. You can clean them up & restore them using the program. You can tell that I have nothing to say but very, very good things about the Flip-Pal. Take it w/ you anywhere, you need to copy documents, no matter their size!! Dee
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: Love my Flip-Pal. It is portable, light-weight, and easy to use. Takes decent scans. For larger photos, you take several scans in different areas of the picture, and the included software "stitches" the picture back together to make the complete one. This technique does requires some trial and error. This little scanner goes where I go, especially if pictures are involved.
customer_reviews.author: Marj

customer_reviews.title: I bought my 1st unit, used it few times ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my 1st unit, used it few times over the Warranty time frame, and it died completely. The vendor stated they would gve me a $50.00 discount on another purchase, which I have yet to see. I purchased the 2nd unit, and within 58 scans, it gives a message " batteries to Low" and no longer works. The vendor has said they are sending another unit to replace it, but I have yet to see that either. I have no confidence in this product at this point.
customer_reviews.author: paul garriott

customer_reviews.title: This is the best little scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little scanner. Very easy to use. I got it for postcrossing to easily scan my postcards. I have had a couple cards that were too big to scan so used the stitch feature and it worked perfectly, you can't tell on the final picture it looks seamless. I am looking forward to taking this to my Mom's to start scanning some of our old photographs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moser

customer_reviews.title: I am delighted.
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting one of these for some time, and it has been fun using it. I have done some stitch scanning with it, and it is amazingly accurate. Love that it scans at 300 dpi, suitable for my digital scrap-booking without having to do anything else unless the photo needs color correction or repair of scratches on the old photo. It is saving me much time and energy that I previously had to expend using my printer/scanner and needs no fumbling with settings, etc. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: rascalhoun

customer_reviews.title: My newest genealogy tool.
customer_reviews.text: I received this scanner a few days ago and I love it. I working on a family book and have been gathering photos, news items, etc. and this little scanner is a great way to get the information into my computer. I love that it so easy to take with me when I visit relatives. It is easy to use, I'm still learning, but so far it has been a breeze. I'm so glad I found this scanner. I highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality. It cuts and sews photos together for printing, perfectly. Light weight and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Riley

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. It's so easy to use. As my friend says, "It's idiot-proof!" The SD card that comes with it has stitching software included and it seamlessly stitches your photos. I LOVE this feature! Love the fact that you can scan items in a photo album without removing them. This is a MUST HAVE for any scrapbooker or anyone who wants to scan and keep digital images of vintage photos! I love that it's completely portable. The ONLY drawback to this item is that it eats batteries like crazy. I'd suggest the company make this with an AC adapter so you can plug it in when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very good and very practical mini scanner especially for oversize pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good and very practical mini scanner especially for oversize pictures even though it's a pain in the neck to scan in segments prior to stitching it with the software
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and portable
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is easy to use and very versatile. It scans quickly and the output is clear and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the purpose of scanning photo albums my mother has had for many years. I'm sure many people have the old style sticky paged albums which are almost impossible to remove photos from without damaging them. This scanner allows you to scan the photos in place without removing them from the album, and without having to tote a heavy laptop at the same time. You get good quality scans, and the stitching program works very well at putting larger pictures together flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lusich

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: This is the cat's meow. Portable and easy to use. The stitching software has performed quite well and better than I expected. The scan quality is quite adequate for my general use in genealogy for copying documents and photos. I purchased a Doxie Flip Carrying Case because of the much better price. This case is adequate for my needs
customer_reviews.author: Earl W Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: A must-have
customer_reviews.text: Anyone interested in genealogy and family history needs a Flip-Pal mobile scanner. It is by far the easiest piece of technology I have ever used. The stitching feature is amazing. I was skeptical about scanning a document that required 9 scans. That little Flip-Pal stitched it together like a charm, and it wasn't due to anything on my part because I certainly wasn't being especially careful about lining up each individual scan.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great investment. It is super easy to use and pictures come out pretty good. Saves a lot of time scanning.
customer_reviews.author: K Jarmon

customer_reviews.title: Mobile scanner
customer_reviews.text: So excited to be able to transfer all of my 30+ year old scrapbook pictures over to the computer. I have really enjoyed this project and am finding it very easy to use and an able to get a more updated look on some really old pictures, taken with a really cheap instematic camera in the 60's and 70's. This way I can consolidate many good memories in a digital format that I think that the generations to come will enjoy far more than my flimsy faded dusty scrapbooks.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Rawls

customer_reviews.title: The only issue I have with it is the scans aren't as high quality as I'd like for some of my old photographs
customer_reviews.text: For ease of use and convenience, 5 star! The only issue I have with it is the scans aren't as high quality as I'd like for some of my old photographs. But it absolutely gets the job done, and is incredibly easy and intuitive to use.
customer_reviews.author: mnash

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea - Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, this was an idea long overdue. I have used it a lot, and get great results of scanning old photos without even taking them out of the old worn albums, and even got great results scanning some still in a frame. SO easy to use and the flash drive has plenty of memory. Also, ordinary batteries hold up well as the scanner does not use that much juice. I am very pleased with this scanner, it is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for awhile and just started using it. I love how this scanner works. It scans images at 300 or 600 dpi. It scans the regular way but I love that you can take the top off,, turn it over and scan which gives more options. For the first time today, I scanned a picture about 15 inches long which I could only do in sections. The software that comes with it blends the picture together perfectly. It is expensive but I don't think you will be sorry. Great for genealogists.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: This is a great device which allows scanning large papers and pictures and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device which allows scanning large papers and pictures and by magic puts them together. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: CK Gund

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly helpful
customer_reviews.text: I'm soooo glad I bought my Flip-Pal. It's the most convenient thing for doing historical research--you can scan as you talk to people. The second most wonderful part is the stitching software. Couldn't believe the absolutely perfect job it does of putting together large newspaper articles that have to be scanned in segments. It's like magic--select the files you want to stitch, and click, it's done. Easy! Excellent value and it goes a long time on its batteries. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Weechella

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner. Easy to use and is super convenient
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic scanner. Easy to use and is super convenient. I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a portable scanner for photos or postcards. I can finally digitize 30 years of photographs to share with family and I love the idea of being able to have copies of everything on a card safely stored away in our safety deposit box.
customer_reviews.author: everyday joe

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, especially for the price paid. Use instructions a little sketchy but workable.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Buhr

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The additional software purchase was not made clear in the product description. The instruction​ manual is very vague.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a lot. Wish is would have come with a card reader but that is something I will remedy. It does eat regular batteries quite fast there for I have resorted to using a rechargeable battery. Also would be nice if it had a power cord. I will use this item when doing my geneology research.
customer_reviews.author: Smc

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Made scanning family photos for my Anestry.com research so much easier and quicker.
customer_reviews.author: PelBro

customer_reviews.title: It is the best scanner for on the go and for pictures
customer_reviews.text: It is the best scanner for on the go and for pictures. I just wish it had a way to plug into electric instead of using batteries all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, after initial hiccups - it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, after initial hiccups - it was delivered with an outdated USB (not compatible with my computer) so I had to buy a new USB stick. Also, my anti-virus software alerted on the Flip-Pal software. I installed the software anyway without apparent problem. I'll definitely switch to rechargable batteries when using the Flip-Pal.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fits well in my backpack
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use when I’m doing genogolgy research at the library
customer_reviews.author: Velma Joe-Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner! I no longer have to get up, go to my printer, scan, go to my computer, repeat over and over in order to scan the hundreds of genealogy pictures that I have collected. I love how easy it is to use and the quality of the pics is great, too. Highly recommend this (and have recommended it to my friends).
customer_reviews.author: rachelsgarden13

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have loads of photos I have inherited. Many are fading away or stuck in those old magnetic albums. This is perfect for scanning them in while watching tv, helping me to get this done faster. The stitching software is very easy to use. Much easier than trying to do it in Photoshop Elements. It didn't work when I tried to scan a picture in a frame. I noticed that it states that some glass is too thick. Possibly that is the problem.
customer_reviews.author: scoope

customer_reviews.title: Exvellent Portability
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and easy to use for scanning. The stitching software is quite good, but have to observe the minimum overlaps of 1 inch
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Kah Bin LIM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: This flip-pal scanner far exceeded my expectations. It is easy to use plus it is portable. My primary focus has been genealogy and the scanner is used to scan old pictures and newspaper articles that do not fit in a normal scanner. It is very easy to stitch a large picture or newspaper article with the results looking just like the original. I have been using this product since Christmas and would certainly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: peppie24

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget was SUPER to be able to make copies of family photos in THEIR home, so they didn't have any discomfort in sharing photos with the family. I was able to scan over 200 photos and used Picasa to crop them as I wanted for a e-album. Super easy to use. Only drawback is it is batteries only and if you have a lot of photos, make sure you have extra batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani

customer_reviews.title: Best scanning device ever invented...
customer_reviews.text: As a person who scans a lot, this device has changed my life. No longer need to risk taking irreplaceable client photographs or documents with me elsewhere to scan, can travel anywhere easily, can even scan fabric and other items. Amazing quality, seamless stitching, easy to use. Rechargeable batteries last a long time, software is better than what I was using, have easily scanned up to 12 pieces consistently. So happy! One suggestion: carry a good quality microfiber cloth as it is easy to get fingerprints on glass when flipping back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Reading

customer_reviews.title: Good, but can't handle heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it five stars, but it seems to have died today after over 1700 scans. It does a great job for what it is. Back to the bulky desktop scanner to finish up my parents photos.
customer_reviews.author: Donnine Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love the little guy!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for what I bought it for - regular size pictures and newspaper articles. I've never stitched any together; but, may not since I have a regular scanner also. Volunteer at a genealogical society research center and find it to be handy for projects we do like preserving obits, school pictures and any small items.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Reener

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for genealogy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been scanning all of my pictures over the past few years. There comes the time that there is a family heirloom or painting or pictures in an album that cannot be removed. That is when the Flip-Pal saves the day. It is so simple to use and comes with the apps needed to stitch multiple scans together into a single image.
customer_reviews.author: Marta R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have boxes, and boxes, of photos taken decades ago. I need to scan all of them into my genealogy program. I like the fact that I can see the scan. I only sit down at 8 or 9 oclock to watch TV. That's when I use my Flip-Pal scanner. One box for unscanned and one box for scanned. I do have a flat top scanner, so I can use it for larger photos. Don't have so many of them....so this is the perfect little, mobile scanner
customer_reviews.author: For Ever Thrifty

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This item works exactly as described. The software is a little tricky to install, but the online support was prompt and helpful. My main uses are to preserve family pictures and documents, and easily post them. It can go anywhere, and does not harm fragile material.The resolution is adequate for most purposes; if you need higher resolution, you will need a digital camera with special lighting, which is bulky to carry around. Unless you are a professional archivist, this will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Flip-pal scanner is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The Flip-pal scanner is easy to use, and I find it scans documents and photos very well. I especially like the editing options. It was shipped quickly, and I received good service.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlon Cobb

customer_reviews.title: genealogy bonus
customer_reviews.text: This makes taking records and posting them online so EASY. photos from albums too. just sit and watch TV with photo book on lap, don't take photo's out of it, just put the flip pal on it and go for it. can cut and paste aka sew photos or documents that are too large for flip pal to manage in one scan.
customer_reviews.author: meb

customer_reviews.title: Giftee Rates It Well
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and the recipient expressed his satisfaction with it. It does take some time to scan, but the results are very good from the response I got. The portability and ease of use makes this a great product for the price. I would recommend it based on the feedback I received. In that I had no first-hand use of this product - I made the 4 star determination.
customer_reviews.author: BillyTheG

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and good scans
customer_reviews.text: Works great and very convenient. I had a lot of photos to scan and job went quickly.
customer_reviews.author: PB2

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last long!!!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is compact and easy to use. Just wish it also had AC power since the batteries (4 AA) don't last long at all! This is frustrating when trying to scan many printed photos. I could not get thru one average size photo album without having to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Flip-Pal
customer_reviews.text: My new Flip-Pal has already been deemed one of the smartest investments I've made recently. The ease of use of this portable little scanner is amazing. So far it's use has been for scanning pictures and organizing without the need of the computer and is portable enough to take to relatives to scanner pictures straight from the albums without taking them out of the albums. Definitely, we worth the investment. No idea at this time how sturdy it will be, but I have positive hopes for a long-term relationship with this little scanner...............
customer_reviews.author: Whizzin'

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I can sit anywhere and scan photos. Take off the cover and scan large items and have the software stitch the sections together automatically. Small, light, and I can take it anywhere with me to scan pictures from friends and relatives. I have scanned photos in albums and frames without any problems also. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ladytex

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, stitch software crashes
customer_reviews.text: Received our Flip-Pal yesterday, works great! Single photo scans are clear, mosaic scanning through the clear undercarriage is its best feature. Scanned in a large document from the 1930's, worked great. Was a bit blurry scanning through glass, but more experimentation is needed. We rate it a four because of the stitch software, it crashes. Have yet to get it to work. Even downloaded the update. However, we took the mosaic scans and imported them into Photoshop Elements, they stitched together flawlessly. For a travel scanner, when visiting relatives or gathering genealogical records, I would highly recommend Filp-Pal!
customer_reviews.author: C. Herring

customer_reviews.title: As a scrapbooker and family historian I love being able to scan photos from a scrapbook without ...
customer_reviews.text: As a scrapbooker and family historian I love being able to scan photos from a scrapbook without having to remove them. It's great to be able to attend a family function and be able to scan photos of family members right at the table. No cords....totally mobile! Wish I'd known about this scanner years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Hillegass

customer_reviews.title: Flip-Pal is Great
customer_reviews.text: Flip-Pal is wonderful to archive your old photos and also to take to libraries while doing genealogy research to scan information in books. Take it to the family reunions to scan others photos (no computer or electricity needed). Got a relative that won't let the family album out of their site--scan right there while the photos are still in the album, no need to remove. Got a photo in a frame--no need to remove--scan right there on the wall. This is a GREAT little machine
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest addition to my travel bag. I visit clients outside of my office and this scanner is small enough to fit into my travel bag. It's mighty enough to handle my scanning needs while on the road. The view screen allows you to see the completed scan. Totaly amazing and so simple to use. I wish I would have purchased this long ago!
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Need to use the software tool that comes with it to trim out the white edge of the scanned photo. It's easy to do. Scan is so quiet and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portability and brilliant
customer_reviews.text: All the features. Portable do not need electricity or laptop. Brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Morebeck

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: I scanned about 50 photos in 10 minutes or so. I'm just thrilled with that because I have a lot of old photos that I want to scan. It's easy to use. I've yet to find where I can delete scanned photos but, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Flip-Pal Scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is so handy when trying to digitize old documents and pictures. It has a zipper software program that takes and automatically seamlessly puts multiple shots of the document or picture. Pretty fantastic. Easy to use. It was recommended by a friend who had one already and she was loving it too!
customer_reviews.author: T. Parsley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my wife & she like the one button functionality as well as the portable aspect.
customer_reviews.author: awsure

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece of equipment for scanning when you are traveling
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful piece of equipment for scanning when you are traveling! I am in contact with people who do not trust having their photos removed from their house and some are so old that removing them from albums would not be wise either. I love the quality of the picture AND the stitching together feature. Amazing piece of technology there!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Shirley Weeks

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it before a trip to a research trip to Kansas when I got to this little boon town there were NO copying services available. It is fabulous. Would never have gotten the 1880 newspaper articles copied any other way. LOVE IT!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: A unique product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Flip-Pal for my wife because she had seen a review and liked the sound of it. It works as advertised and the "stitching" software that comes with it is amazing. I have no idea how they can take a dozen image patches and sew them together into a perfect large image. Phenomenal. Also works fairly quickly and quietly. Good for items that are too big for the normal letter or legal sized flat bed scanner such as newspaper articles without having to either cut them out of the paper or fold the paper like origami to get it into the flatbed.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C Sykora

customer_reviews.title: Have used this hundreds of times with no problem. ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this hundreds of times with no problem.......except, picture doesn't line up as expected. Must be rotated afterward in gallery.
customer_reviews.author: STEBOU

customer_reviews.title: Skip this product
customer_reviews.text: There are lines in all my picture scans. Darn thing is easy and portable... but the quality makes it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ak_me

customer_reviews.title: Nice thing to have
customer_reviews.text: This scanner lets me scan photos from my mom's old photo albums which are falling apart. Nice thing to have. I plan to take it to a cousins to scan some of her old family photos.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Plate

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the best resolution but ok for quick portable jobs.
customer_reviews.author: ronct

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool for anyone that is working on their family ...
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool for anyone that is working on their family tree. Love the ease of use, and the scans are true to picture. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: frugal grandma

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very, very easy to use. Started scanning photos as soon as I unwrapped it. I do wish I could scan bigger items but for a scanner that is small and easy to carry for travel this one is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Blake

customer_reviews.title: Flip-Pal Mobile Scanner...Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: A friend showed me their Flip-Pal Mobile Scanner. I was impressed when I saw it first used and continue to be now that I'm using it myself. This is a fabulous product...works in every situation...priced right...goes anywhere we go! Great for Family History Research or just having fun with images.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Lucky

customer_reviews.title: So quick and great clarity. I use it for genealogy--both documents and ...
customer_reviews.text: So quick and great clarity. I use it for genealogy--both documents and photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Ann H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works great. The only thing con to say about it it love batteries with no option to plug in.
customer_reviews.author: B Couture

product_meta.title: Flip-Pal mobile scanner with 4GB SD card and USB adapter. EasyStitch and StoryScans talking images software
product_meta.description: The Flip-Pal mobile scanner enables you to effortlessly collect precious photos, important documents, fragile records of personal and family history, detailed coins, jewelry, medals, hand-drawn art, and other keepsakes. Now they can be safely stored digitally rather than scattered, lost or unable to be found. Then create your story and connect with family and friends. Take advantage of the patented flip-and-scan technology to scan photos while still in the album or frame, treating fragile personal records gently. The Easy Stitch software quickly and automatically reassembles multiple scans into their larger original. Unlike alternative solutions that don't have the combination of mobility, simplicity, accuracy, versatility, and keeping the original safe, the Flip-Pal mobile scanner is compact, simple to operate, has high resolution, quick scan time, battery power, SD memory, and a computer is not required to scan. When it really matters, like your children's early years of precious memories, preparing for natural disaster, creating a high quality scrapbook, or collecting one-of-a-kind fragile documents for your family history, Flip-Pal produces the accurate image quality you will need in the future. With 600 and 300 dpi resolutions and colors and textures that are true to original, your important documents and images are safeguarded forever in digital format, protected from loss from disasters and misfortune.
feature_bullets: The Flip-Pal mobile scanner is the world's original scanner for photos, large and fragile documents, and cherished memorabilia that does not require a computer to operate. Battery powered and stores files stored on an SD card.

Transform images into endearing stories. StoryScans software combines the recorded voice of the storyteller and the scan into a single file that is both small and High Definition. *Download and activation may be required.

Keep your memories safe using patented flip-and-scan technology. Fragile documents are treated safely on the flatbed rather than fed through a sheet feeder. Take the lid off, flip the scanner over, and use the window to frame the original.

All sizes, small to very large, can be scanned. The included EasyStitch software automatically reassembles multiple scans of larger originals such as portraits, art, documents, and quilts. Small objects such as coins and stamps have high detail.

Quick and easy operation. Just 7 seconds to scan 4 x 6" at 300 dpi. Simply turn the power on and press the green scan button. The software is stored on the SD card. Save hours of removing photos from their album. Do your first scan in minutes after opening the box

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars450 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
